title: How to Dress and Groom Yourself for a Movie Date

steps.title: Go for a comfortable yet put together look.
steps.content: Go for a comfortable yet put together look. You shouldn’t dress formally for a movie date, but you also shouldn’t show up in yesterday’s t-shirt and shorts. Pick something casual that you look good in and feel confident wearing. [1] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019. Go for an outfit that is comfortable, a little bit flirty, and well put together.

steps.title: Avoid tight clothing.
steps.content: Avoid tight clothing. You will be sitting in the theatre for several hours. Tight clothing can affect your circulation and make you uncomfortable. Instead of wearing tight jeans, opt for a pair that give you some room to breathe while still flattering your figure. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Try a relaxed button down top.
steps.content: Try a relaxed button down top. Button down tops look put together without being too formal. Try wearing a button down top made of a light, breathable fabric like cotton. You can pair the top with your favorite jeans or even a skirt. [3] X Research source Avoid wearing a formal dress shirt or something like a suit to a movie date. [4] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019.

steps.title: Go for a classic t-shirt.
steps.content: Go for a classic t-shirt. If a button down shirt isn’t your thing, try wearing a classic t-shirt on your movie date. You can opt for a simple tee without graphics. You can also wear a t-shirt with your favorite fashion or band logo. Just make sure the t-shirt is clean and free of stains, holes, or tears.

steps.title: Wear a pair of comfortable jeans.
steps.content: Wear a pair of comfortable jeans. You can pair a classic t-shirt or button down shirt with a pair of jeans for a laid-back movie date. Instead of squeezing into those uncomfortable, yet fashionable jeans, go for a pair you can comfortably sit in for several hours. Try dark denim for a more refined look, and leave the jeans with holes at home.

steps.title: Go for a casual but flirty dress.
steps.content: Go for a casual but flirty dress. The movie theatre is no place for that stunning cocktail dress. Instead of wearing a more formal dress, try something that is casual and flatters your figure. For example, you can wear a cotton wrap dress for a sexy, yet comfortable vibe. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Bring along a sweater.
steps.content: Bring along a sweater. The movie theatre can be cold! If you don’t want to spend the movie shivering, or if you tend to get cold easily, take along a sweater. Try wearing a stylish cardigan that will add dome pep to a pair of jeans and simple t-shirt. [6] X Research source Reader Poll: By the way, we asked 622 wikiHow readers about what movie genre makes for the best first date, and only 9% of them recommended action movies . [Take Poll] So if you’re planning a movie date, consider sticking to romance, comedy, or dramas!

steps.title: Shower before the date.
steps.content: Shower before the date. You want to be fresh and clean for your movie date. Make sure you take a shower or bath as close as possible to the time of your date. Try using a soap or body wash with a neutral scent, or one that matches your perfume or cologne. Avoid strong scents - you'll be sitting next to your date for a couple of hours, so keep things neutral to make the experience comfortable for your date, too.

steps.title: Wash your hair.
steps.content: Wash your hair. You should also make sure that your hair is clean for your movie date. While you are taking a shower or bath, wash your hair with shampoo and then condition it as you normally would. Avoid using dry shampoo, which does not clean your scalp or hair. Make sure you dry your hair with a hairdryer or leave enough time to let it air dry.

steps.title: Apply deodorant and/or antiperspirant.
steps.content: Apply deodorant and/or antiperspirant. Once you bathe and finish washing your hair, apply a deodorant or antiperspirant to help control body odor and/or perspiration. Try wearing deodorant even if you think you don’t need it. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Style your hair.
steps.content: Style your hair. While you don’t want to go over the top with your hairstyle for a movie date, you should at least make sure your hair is combed and looking neat. If you have longer hair, try a simple ponytail or braid. You can also go for a more involved up-do like a bun or topknot. If you have shorter hair, you can just comb or brush it and set the style in place with a little gel or hairspray. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Try wearing simple makeup.
steps.content: Try wearing simple makeup . A movie date is an opportunity to look your best while still looking casual. Less can be more on a movie date as far as makeup is concerned. Instead of wearing intense eye makeup and bold lip color, try more neutral tones. For example, go for a taupe eye shadow, mascara, and a little lip gloss.

steps.title: Brush your teeth.
steps.content: Brush your teeth. You will want to make sure you have fresh breath for your movie date. Right before you walk out the door, brush your teeth. You can also floss and use mouthwash if you desire. Avoid eating anything that might give you bad breath after you brush your teeth.
